div.l: Whom that he brynge in to hys pryuyte
I prey to god so yeue me sorow and care
Yf euyr sith that I hyghte hodge of ware
Herd I myller bet y set a werk
He hadde a Iape of malice in the derk
But god forbede that we stynten here
And therfore yf ye vouchesauf to here
A tale of me that am a poure man
I wol you telle as wel as I can
A lytyl Iape that fyl in our cyte
Our hoste answerd ⁊ sayde I graunt it the
Now telle on roger loke that it be good
For many a pasty hast thou lete blood
And many a iacke of douyr hast thou sold
That had be twys hoot and twys cold
Of many a pylgrym hast thou crystis curs
For of thy persely yet fare they the wers
That they haue eten wyth the stubbed ghoos
For in thy shop is many a flye loos
Now tel on gentyl Roger by thy name
But I pray the be not wrothfor game
Aman may say ful soth in game and pley
Thou sayst soth sayde Roger by my fey
But soth pley quade pley as þe flemyng saith
And therfore harry bally by thy feyth
Be thou not wroth ar we departen here
Though that my tale be of an hostyllere
But natheles I wyl not telle it yet
But or we depart I wis thou shalt be quyt
And therwyth al he lowgh and made chere
And sayd hys tale as ye shul aftyr here
Here endyth the Cokis prologe
And begynneth hys tale
